definitions.definition: An instance, or the act of suddenly plunging downward.
definitions.example: The quality of decision is like the well-timed swoop of a falcon which enables it to strike and destroy its victim. – Sun Tzu

definitions.definition: A quick passage from one note to the next.
To fly or glide downwards suddenly; to plunge (in the air) or nosedive.
definitions.example: The lone eagle swooped down into the lake, snatching its prey, a small fish.

definitions.definition: To move swiftly, as if with a sweeping movement, especially to attack something.
definitions.example: The dog had enthusiastically swooped down on the bone.

definitions.definition: To fall on at once and seize; to catch while on the wing.
To seize; to catch up; to take with a sweep.
To pass with pomp; to sweep.
